sentence: On Monday, Arizona state Rep. Mark Finchem (Trump’s endorsed candidate for secretary of state) introduced a resolution seeking to decertify the results in Maricopa, Pima and Yuma counties — more than a year after the presidential election and following numerous fruitless attempts at digging up evidence that a massive voter fraud scheme cost Trump the presidency.
author: Liz Skalka
title: Arizona Republican Says His Daughter Got Text Calling Him 'N-Word' RINO

sentence: Within hours of Arizona state Rep. Mark Finchem (R) introducing his bill to “decertify” and “set aside” the 2020 election results in three of Arizona’s largest counties, two things happened.
author: Cristina Cabrera
title: Trump-Endorsed Arizona Secretary of State Candidate Has A Show Bill To ‘Decertify’ 2020

sentence: One conspiracy kook, Rep. Mark Finchem, even tried to have the 2020 elections from Maricopa, Pima and Yuma counties set aside.
author: EJ Montini
title: Does the NFL have the guts to move the 2023 Super Bowl out of Arizona?
